intro: Gamochaeta capitata, commonly known as the clustered blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small blue to purple flowers are arranged in compact clusters at the ends of the stems. Gamochaeta capitata is often found in marshy soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
